title: quarkus-spring-boot-properties does not support @Bean annotated methods

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

body:
### Describe the bug

As per Spring's `@ConfigurationProperties` annotation javadoc, the following syntax is supported:

```java
@Configuration
public class MyConfigClass {
  @Bean
  @ConfigurationProperties("my-prefix")
  public MyPropertyMappingClass properties() {
    return new MyPropertyMappingClass();
  }
}
```

> Annotation for externalized configuration. Add this to a class definition or a `@Bean` method in a `@Configuration` class if you want to bind and validate some external Properties (e.g. from a .properties file).

However, when run in a quarkus context with the quarkus-spring-boot-properties extension, Quarkus duplicates the bean, which fails the build:

```
Caused by: io.quarkus.builder.BuildException: Build failure: Build failed due to errors
	[error]: Build step io.quarkus.arc.deployment.ArcProcessor#validate threw an exception: javax.enterprise.inject.spi.DeploymentException: javax.enterprise.inject.AmbiguousResolutionException: Ambiguous dependencies for type com.example.MyProperties and qualifiers [@Default]
	- java member: PropertyInjectionQuarkusTest#myProperties
	- declared on CLASS bean [types=[java.lang.Object, PropertyInjectionQuarkusTest], qualifiers=[@Default, @Any], target=PropertyInjectionQuarkusTest]
	- available beans:
		- PRODUCER METHOD bean [types=[com.example.MyProperties, java.lang.Object], qualifiers=[@Named(value = "props"), @Default, @Any], target=com.example.MyProperties props(), declaringBean=com.example.MyConfig]
		- PRODUCER METHOD bean [types=[com.example.MyProperties, java.lang.Object], qualifiers=[@Default, @Any], target=com.example.MyProperties produceMyProperties(org.eclipse.microprofile.config.Config), declaringBean=io.quarkus.arc.runtime.config.ConfigPropertiesProducer]
```

### Expected behavior

Quarkus should define a single bean for a method annotated with Spring `@Bean` and `@ConfigurationProperties`.

### Actual behavior

Both annotations seem to be handled separately, leading to a duplicate bean definition and collision.

### How to Reproduce?

[reproducer.tar.gz](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/9064336/reproducer.tar.gz)

Simply run the `PropertyInjectionQuarkusTest` test class

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

Detected on 2.7.x, reproduced with 2.10.2.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
